intro: Monotes discolor, commonly known as the variable monotes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
